Tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to draw their cloaks (veils) all over their bodies (i.e. screen themselves completely except the eyes or one eye to see the way). That will be better, that they should be known (as free respectable women) so as not to be annoyed. And Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.[3]
translations.english_rwwad: O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters, and the believing women to draw their outer garments over themselves; that is more likely that they will be known [as chaste women] and will not be harassed. And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

arabic_text: ۞ لَّئِن لَّمۡ يَنتَهِ ٱلۡمُنَٰفِقُونَ وَٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡمُرۡجِفُونَ فِي ٱلۡمَدِينَةِ لَنُغۡرِيَنَّكَ بِهِمۡ ثُمَّ لَا يُجَاوِرُونَكَ فِيهَآ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗا
phonetic: 33.60 La'in Lam Yantahi Al-Munāfiqūna Wa Al-Ladhīna Fī Qulūbihim Marađun Wa Al-Murjifūna Fī Al-Madīnati Lanughriyannaka Bihim Thumma Lā Yujāwirūnaka Fīhā 'Illā Qalīlāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1212]- Referring here to those who commit adultery or fornication.

translations.english_saheeh: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease[1212] and those who spread rumors in al-Madīnah do not cease, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little,
translations.english_hilali_khan: If the hypocrites, and those in whose hearts is a disease (evil desire for illegal sex), and those who spread false news among the people in Al-Madinah stop not, We shall certainly let you overpower them: then they will not be able to stay in it as your neighbours but a little while.
translations.english_rwwad: If the hypocrites and those who have sickness in their hearts, and the rumormongers in Madinah do not desist, We will surely instruct you [O Prophet] to overpower them, then they will not remain in the city with you except for a short while.

arabic_text: مَّلۡعُونِينَۖ أَيۡنَمَا ثُقِفُوٓاْ أُخِذُواْ وَقُتِّلُواْ تَقۡتِيلٗا
phonetic: 33.61 Mal`ūnīna 'Aynamā Thuqifū 'Ukhidhū Wa Quttilū Taqtīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: Accursed wherever they are found, [being] seized and massacred completely.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Accursed, they shall be seized wherever found, and killed with a (terrible) slaughter.
translations.english_rwwad: They are cursed; wherever they are found they should be seized and killed outright.

arabic_text: سُنَّةَ ٱللَّهِ فِي ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوۡاْ مِن قَبۡلُۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّةِ ٱللَّهِ تَبۡدِيلٗا
phonetic: 33.62 Sunnata Allāhi Fī Al-Ladhīna Khalaw Min Qablu Wa Lan Tajida Lisunnati Allāhi Tabdīlāan

translations.english_saheeh: [This is] the established way of Allāh with those who passed on before; and you will not find in the way of Allāh any change.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That was the Way of Allâh in the case of those who passed away of old: and you will not find any change in the Way of Allâh.
translations.english_rwwad: Such was Allah’s way with those [hypocrites] who came before, and you will find no change in Allah’s way.

arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُكَ ٱلنَّاسُ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِۖ قُلۡ إِنَّمَا عِلۡمُهَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِۚ وَمَا يُدۡرِيكَ لَعَلَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ تَكُونُ قَرِيبًا
phonetic: 33.63 Yas'aluka An-Nāsu `Ani As-Sā`ati Qul 'Innamā `Ilmuhā `Inda Allāhi Wa Mā Yudrīka La`alla As-Sā`ata Takūnu Qarībāan

translations.english_saheeh: People ask you concerning the Hour. Say, "Knowledge of it is only with Allāh. And what may make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near."
translations.english_hilali_khan: People ask you concerning the Hour, say: "The knowledge of it is with Allâh only. What do you know? It may be that the Hour is near!"
translations.english_rwwad: People ask you [O Prophet] concerning the Hour. Say, “Its knowledge is only with Allah.” How could you know? Perhaps the Hour is near.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ وَأَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ سَعِيرًا
phonetic: 33.64 'Inna Allāha La`ana Al-Kāfirīna Wa 'A`adda Lahum Sa`īrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, Allāh has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, Allâh has cursed the disbelievers, and has prepared for them a flaming Fire (Hell).
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and has prepared for them a Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدٗاۖ لَّا يَجِدُونَ وَلِيّٗا وَلَا نَصِيرٗا
phonetic: 33.65 Khālidīna Fīhā 'Abadāan Lā Yajidūna Walīyāan Wa Lā Naşīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Abiding therein forever, they will not find a protector or a helper.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Wherein they will abide for ever, and they will find neither a Walî (a protector) nor a helper.
translations.english_rwwad: abiding therein forever, never will they find any protector or helper.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تُقَلَّبُ وُجُوهُهُمۡ فِي ٱلنَّارِ يَقُولُونَ يَٰلَيۡتَنَآ أَطَعۡنَا ٱللَّهَ وَأَطَعۡنَا ٱلرَّسُولَا۠
phonetic: 33.66 Yawma Tuqallabu Wujūhuhum Fī An-Nāri Yaqūlūna Yā Laytanā 'Aţa`nā Allāha Wa 'Aţa`nā Ar-Rasūlā

translations.english_saheeh: The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed Allāh and obeyed the Messenger."
translations.english_hilali_khan: On the Day when their faces will be turned over in the Fire, they will say: "Oh, would that we had obeyed Allâh and obeyed the Messenger (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)."
translations.english_rwwad: On the Day when their faces are turned over in the Fire, they will say, “Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!”

arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّآ أَطَعۡنَا سَادَتَنَا وَكُبَرَآءَنَا فَأَضَلُّونَا ٱلسَّبِيلَا۠
phonetic: 33.67 Wa Qālū Rabbanā 'Innā 'Aţa`nā Sādatanā Wa Kubarā'anā Fa'ađallūnā As-Sabīlā

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1213]- Also interpreted to mean "our noble ones and our elders [i.e., distinguished scholars]."

translations.english_saheeh: And they will say, "Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries,[1213] and they led us astray from the [right] way.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And they will say: "Our Lord! Verily, we obeyed our chiefs and our great ones, and they misled us from the (Right) Way.
translations.english_rwwad: They will say, “Our Lord, we obeyed our chiefs and our elders, but they led us astray from the [right] way.

arabic_text: رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِهِمۡ ضِعۡفَيۡنِ مِنَ ٱلۡعَذَابِ وَٱلۡعَنۡهُمۡ لَعۡنٗا كَبِيرٗا
phonetic: 33.68 Rabbanā 'Ātihim Đi`fayni Mina Al-`Adhābi Wa Al-`Anhum La`nāan Kabīrāan

translations.english_saheeh: Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Our Lord! Give them double torment and curse them with a mighty curse!"
translations.english_rwwad: Our Lord, give them a double punishment and curse them with a mighty curse.”

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ لَا تَكُونُواْ كَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاذَوۡاْ مُوسَىٰ فَبَرَّأَهُ ٱللَّهُ مِمَّا قَالُواْۚ وَكَانَ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَجِيهٗا
phonetic: 33.69 Yā 'Ayyuhā Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Lā Takūnū Kālladhīna 'Ādhaw Mūsá Fabarra'ahu Allāhu Mimmā Qālū Wa Kāna `Inda Allāhi Wajīhāan

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.33:69) Narrated Abû Hurairah رضي الله عنه: Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "(Prophet) Mûsâ (Moses) was a shy person and used to cover his body completely because of his extensive shyness. One of the Children of Israel annoyed him by saying, ‘He covers his body in this way only because of some defect in his skin, either leprosy or scrotal hernia, or he had some other defect.’ Allah wished to clear Mûsâ (Moses) of what they said about him: so one day while Mûsâ (Moses) was in seclusion, he took off his clothes and put them on a stone and started taking a bath. When he had finished the bath, he moved towards his clothes so as to take them, but the stone took his clothes and fled. Mûsâ (Moses) picked up his stick and ran after the stone saying, ‘O stone! give me my clothes!’ till he reached a group of Banî Israel who saw him naked then, and found him the best of what Allah had created; and Allah cleared him of what they had accused him of. The stone stopped there and Mûsâ (Moses) took and put his garment on and started hitting the stone with his stick. By Allah, the stone still has some traces of the hitting: three, four or five marks. This was what Allah عز وجل refers to in His Saying:
‘O you who believe! Be not like those, who annoyed Mûsâ (Moses), but Allâh cleared him of that which they alleged and he was honourable before Allâh...’ " (V.33:69) (Sahih Al Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadîth No. 616).

translations.english_saheeh: O you who have believed, be not like those who abused Moses; then Allāh cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of Allāh, was distinguished.
translations.english_hilali_khan: O you who believe! Be not like those who annoyed Mûsa (Moses), but Allâh cleared him of that which they alleged, and he was honourable before Allâh.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: O you who believe, do not be like those who maligned Moses, but Allah cleared him of what they said; he was highly honored before Allah.

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَقُولُواْ قَوۡلٗا سَدِيدٗا
phonetic: 33.70 Yā 'Ayyuhā Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Attaqū Allāha Wa Qūlū Qawlāan Sadīdāan

translations.english_saheeh: O you who have believed, fear Allāh and speak words of appropriate justice.
translations.english_hilali_khan: O you who believe! Keep your duty to Allâh and fear Him, and speak (always) the truth.
translations.english_rwwad: O you who believe, fear Allah and say what is right,

arabic_text: يُصۡلِحۡ لَكُمۡ أَعۡمَٰلَكُمۡ وَيَغۡفِرۡ لَكُمۡ ذُنُوبَكُمۡۗ وَمَن يُطِعِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَقَدۡ فَازَ فَوۡزًا عَظِيمًا
phonetic: 33.71 Yuşliĥ Lakum 'A`mālakum Wa Yaghfir Lakum Dhunūbakum Wa Man Yuţi`i Allāha Wa Rasūlahu Faqad Fāza Fawzāan `Ažīmāan

translations.english_saheeh: He will [then] amend for you your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He will direct you to do righteous good deeds and will forgive you your sins. And whosoever obeys Allâh and His Messenger (صلى الله عليه وسلم), he has indeed achieved a great achievement (i.e. he will be saved from the Hell-fire and will be admitted to Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: He will guide you to righteous deeds and forgive your sins. Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger will surely achieve a supreme triumph.

arabic_text: إِنَّا عَرَضۡنَا ٱلۡأَمَانَةَ عَلَى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَٱلۡجِبَالِ فَأَبَيۡنَ أَن يَحۡمِلۡنَهَا وَأَشۡفَقۡنَ مِنۡهَا وَحَمَلَهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ ظَلُومٗا جَهُولٗا
phonetic: 33.72 'Innā `Arađnā Al-'Amānata `Alá As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Al-Jibāli Fa'abayna 'An Yaĥmilnahā Wa 'Ashfaqna Minhā Wa Ĥamalahā Al-'Insānu 'Innahu Kāna Žalūmāan Jahūlāan

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1214]- The acceptance of obligations and obedience to Allāh.
[1215]- Coveting its reward while forgetting the penalty for failure to keep his commitment.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, We offered the Trust[1214] to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they declined to bear it and feared it; but man [undertook to] bear it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.[1215]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly, We did offer Al-Amânah (the trust or moral responsibility or honesty and all the duties which Allâh has ordained) to the heavens and the earth, and the mountains, but they declined to bear it and were afraid of it (i.e. afraid of Allâh’s Torment). But man bore it. Verily, he was unjust (to himself) and ignorant (of its results).[2]
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, We offered the Trust to the heavens, the earth, and the mountains, yet they refused to bear it and were afraid of it. But man assumed it; he is indeed wrongful and ignorant.

arabic_text: لِّيُعَذِّبَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡمُنَٰفِقِينَ وَٱلۡمُنَٰفِقَٰتِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكَٰتِ وَيَتُوبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَى ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورٗا رَّحِيمَۢا
phonetic: 33.73 Liyu`adhiba Allāhu Al-Munāfiqīna Wa Al-Munāfiqāti Wa Al-Mushrikīna Wa Al-Mushrikāti Wa Yatūba Allāhu `Alá Al-Mu'uminīna Wa Al-Mu'umināti Wa Kāna Allāhu Ghafūrāan Raĥīmāan

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1216]- The reason for which mankind was permitted to carry the Trust.

translations.english_saheeh: [It[1216] was] so that Allāh may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the men and women who associate others with Him and that Allāh may accept repentance from the believing men and believing women. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So that Allâh will punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the men and women who are Al-Mushrikûn (polytheists, idolaters, pagans, disbelievers, in the Oneness of Allâh, and His Messenger Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم). And Allâh will pardon (accept the repentance of) the true believers of the Islâmic Monotheism, men and women. And Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: [As a result of that] Allah will punish the hypocrite men and women, and the polytheist men and women, and Allah will accept the repentance of the believing men and women, for Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
